page.title: 04LANDSCAPE: ROCKS OF URCHFONT
page.content: stones).In the south of Wiltshire people used to make houses out of a kind of concrete made of chalk and so they had big over hanging eves to keep the rain off the walls so they don't wash away.On the slopes of Urchfont hill there was a chalk pit that provided chalk to put on the roads and fields because chalk has lime in which is good for the soil,and they put it on the roads to try and stop them wearing away.In Urchfont there are still quite a few of these tracks which are called hollow_ways because they are sunken.There were two brickplots in Urchfont which made bricks for the community out of local clay that they stamped,put in molds and fired.
